Webrings

A webring, one of the many artifacts of the early Internet, is a (sometimes thematic) set of websites that is organized as a chain, with each website pointing to a previous and a next website.

The beauty is the webring is that one can navigate the Internet without having to consult a search engine. It‚Äôs a public form of the cozy web that I quite enjoy.

I‚Äôm pleased that webrings continue to be appreciated in certain corners of the web.

I‚Äôm currently part of these webrings:

  • IndieWeb Webring
  • Yesterweb

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She has a keen interest in (digital) humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking.

Zinzy appreciates you respecting the BY-NC-SA 4.0. This is edition 1669890163.
